api.options

Class AbstractOption

  • java.lang.Object
    • api.options.AbstractOption
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractParameteredOption

    public abstract class AbstractOption
extends Object
    The AbstractOption class represents a named option with no parameter. An unnamed option without parameter could be a flag.
    Author:
    Loris

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String OPTION_PREFIX
      The prefix of each option name: '--' (two times the minus character).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected AbstractOption(String name)
      Creates a new option with the given name.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getOptionName()
      Returns this option's appearance in the synopsis of commands without it's parameters name.
      String getSimpleName()
      Returns the simple name of this option.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • OPTION_PREFIX

        public static final String OPTION_PREFIX
        The prefix of each option name: '--' (two times the minus character).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractOption

        protected AbstractOption(String name)
                  throws IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new option with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the option. The name is not empty nor does it contain anything but alphabetical characters.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the name is empty or does contain any non-alphabetical character.
        NullPointerException - If the name is null.

    • Method Detail

      • getSimpleName

        public String getSimpleName()
        Returns the simple name of this option.
        Returns:
        The simple name of this option.

      • getOptionName

        public final String getOptionName()
        Returns this option's appearance in the synopsis of commands without it's parameters name. If this option would be named like 'option' this method would return --option.
        Returns:
        This option's appearance in the synopsis of commands without it's parameters name.
